intro: Rinorea coriacea, commonly known as the roughleaf rinorea, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its rough, bark-like texture on its leaves, which gives it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Rinorea coriacea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
